sen.j: 下毛野 稻麻呂（しもつけぬ の いなまろ、？ - 772年1月13日（宝亀2年11月30日 (旧暦)））は奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Inamaro (year of birth unknown-January 13, 772) was a noble who lived during Nara period.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Inamaro (year of birth unknown-January 13, 772) was a noble who lived during Nara period.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Inamaro (year of birth unknown-January 13, 772) was a noble who lived during Nara period.
His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 743年（天平15年）5月5日 (旧暦) - 従六位上であった稻麻呂は、聖武天皇より外従五位下を下賜される。
sen.e: On June 5, 743, Inamaro who had been Jurokuinojo (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was granted Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto) by the Emperor Shomu.

On June 5, 743 or May 5 on the old calendar, Inamaro who had been Jurokuinojo (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was granted Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto) by the Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: On June 5, 743, Inamaro who had been Jurokuinojo (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was granted Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto) by the Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 746年（天平18年）4月22日 (旧暦) - 聖武天皇より従五位下を下賜される。
sen.e: Granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by the Emperor Shomu on May 20, 746.
Granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by the Emperor Shomu on May 20, 746 or April 22 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: Granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by the Emperor Shomu on May 20, 746.

sen.j: 757年（天平宝字元年）5月20日 (旧暦) - 孝謙天皇より従五位上を下賜される。
sen.e: Granted Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by the Empress Koken on June 15, 757.
Granted Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by the Empress Koken on June 15, 757 or May 20 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: Granted Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by the Empress Koken on June 15, 757.

sen.j: 760年（天平宝字4年）1月4日 (旧暦) - 淳仁天皇より正五位上を下賜される。
sen.e: Granted Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by Emperor Junnin on January 30, 760.
Granted Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by Emperor Junnin on January 30, 760 or January 4 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: Granted Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by Emperor Junnin on January 30, 760.

sen.j: 768年（神護景雲2年）11月28日 (旧暦) - 称徳天皇より従四位下を下賜される。
sen.e: Granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) by Empress Shotoku on January 14, 769.
Granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) by Empress Shotoku on January 14, 769 or November 28, 768 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: Granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) by Empress Shotoku on January 14, 769.

sen.j: 771年（宝亀2年）11月30日 (旧暦) - 従四位下にて没す。
sen.e: On January 13, 772, he died staying at the rank of Jushiinoge.
On January 13, 772 or November 30, 771 on the old calendar, he died staying at the rank of Jushiinoge.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: On January 13, 772, he died staying at the rank of Jushiinoge.
